page.title: 15Coastal walk (cont).
page.content: Other things that can be seen on the walk through the village include the old railway viaduct, Crusoe hotel, Man Friday's cafe. To the west of the hotel lies Kiel's burn which has been used by mills in the past. Access to the shore is obtained by a causeway and this leads on to a beautiful sandy beach with substantial dune areas. From here the path passes a beautiful beach play park.There are wartime pillboxes near Lundin Links golf course.Marram grass is again prominent with 5 year old Scotch pine to stabilise the dunes.Beyond the golf club house there are further defences against the sea using railway sleepers. From here the trail leads SW along the beach to Leven.
